_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Hoses, valves, pipes, pumps, and tanks

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Mann Agicultural Supply, Inc.
Papillion, Nebraska

Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION & EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The accidental release prevention policy at Mann Agricultural Supply, Inc. involves, but is not limitd to technologies, procedures, and management practices.  This facility conforms to the laws and regulations of the State of Nebraska.  Our emergency response policy involves the prepaation of action plans that are tailored to our facility and to the emergency response services available in our community, and is in compliance with the EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION and REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

This facility is in the business of selling Anhydrous Ammonia to farm customers as a form of Nitrogen fertilizer.  The facility has one storage tank with a capacity of 18,000 gallons water capacity. Additionally several Anhydrous Ammonia nurse tanks, risers for filling nurse tanks, electrical panels, lighting, and safety equipment are all parts of this facilities operation.  The facility operates with normal business hours during the spring and fall season.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE and CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The off-site consequences analysis includes two Anhydrous Ammonia release scenarios, identified as "worst-case release" and "alternative release".  The first scenario is defined by EPA,  and assumes the maximum quantity of the largest vessel is released as a gas in 10 minutes due to a catastrophic break.  The alternative release scenario is defined as a more likely accidental release caused by a transfer hose failure.  Anticipated results of both scenarios are included in our Risk Management Program and have also been supplied to our Local Emergency Planning Committee thru the Sarpy County Emergency Manager.

Mann Agricultural Supply, Inc has several key elements in our accident preventation plan:

1.  The Anhydrous Ammonia system adheres to the laws and regulations of the S

tate of Ne braska.
2.  Annual training is required of all personnel handling, transferring, or transporting Anhydrous Ammonia.  Our
     training includes properties of ammonia, safe handling practices, first aid, and emergency response actions
3.  Use of good management practices as specified by industry standards and training aids.
4.  Frequent site inspections by management and safety consultants.
5.  Annual inspections include safety equipment, tanks, and handling equipment.
6.  Use of proper Anhydrous Ammonia personal protective euipment and safety equipment.

FIVE - YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Mann Agricultural Supply, Inc. has not had a reportable Anhydrous Ammonia discharge within the past five years. 

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
 
Even though the company has not had a release, we still coordinate visits with the local fire department to review the systems and procedures for response to a leak.  Our facility is included in the Hazrdous Materials portion of the Community Emergency Response Plan as prepared by the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) AND THE Nebraska Emergency Management Agency (NEMA). We have provided State and Local authorities with all Community Right-to-Know information requested, as well as that required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).  Our employee training and safety programs include pre-emergency planning and are offered for review at any time by our LEPC to ensure that they conform to the commuity plan(s).

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Safety is an on-going process at our facility.  Changes are made in systems when necessary or when required by regulation change.  Periodic evaluations of the procedures help to determine whether or not a change in operaions should be made to provide increased safety to the operators and to the community.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

For additional information, response to questions, or comments about our operations, please contact:

       Mark Mann       Phone (402)339-4471 days, or (402) 510-5787 aft
